original: yang na bsngags pa mi zad rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir yon tan zhes bya ba 'di'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: yang na bsngags pa mi zad rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir yon tan zhes bya ba 'di'i khyad par yin te /
translated: Or, the “inexhaustible ocean of praise” is a common locus, and therefore it is a particular of this “good quality.”

original: bsngags pa mi zad pa rgya mtsho rnams rab tu brjod cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsngags pa mi zad pa rgya mtsho rnams rab tu brjod cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he proclaims the inexhaustible ocean of praise.

original: da ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag nyid la mchod pa bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa rnam pa gnyis bstan pa la /🔽bla na yod pa ni me tog dam pa zhes bya ba @236a * //
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag nyid la mchod pa bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa rnam pa gnyis bstan pa la / bla na yod pa ni me tog dam pa zhes bya ba @236a * //
translated: Now, in order to teach the two kinds of worship of those very Blessed Buddhas, the surpassable and the unsurpassable,

original: la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: the surpassable is taught by two verses beginning with “the best of flowers.”

original: me tog la sogs pa'i nang na dam pa gang yin pa'i me tog dam pa dang / phreng ba dam pa dang / sel snyan dam pa dang / tsan dan dang gur kum la sogs pa byug pa dam pa dang / gdugs dam pa dang /
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa'i nang na dam pa gang yin pa'i me tog dam pa dang / phreng ba dam pa dang / sel snyan dam pa dang / tsan dan dang gur kum la sogs pa byug pa dam pa dang / gdugs dam pa dang /
translated: The best of flowers and so on, the best of flowers, the best of garlands, the best of incense, the best of ointments such as sandalwood and saffron, the best of parasols,

original: mar me dam pa dang / bdug pa dam pa dang / na bza' dam pa dang / dri sna tshogs sbyar ba'i di dam pa dang / tsan dan dang gur kum dang ga pur dang aa ga ru la sogs pa'i phye ma'i phur ma ri rab dang mnyam pa de dag gis so //
analyzed: mar me dam pa dang / bdug pa dam pa dang / na bza' dam pa dang / dri sna tshogs sbyar ba'i di dam pa dang / tsan dan dang gur kum dang ga pur dang aa ga ru la sogs pa'i phye ma'i phur ma ri rab dang mnyam pa de dag gis so //
translated: the best of lamps, the best of incense, the best of clothing, the best of powders made from various fragrances, and heaps of sandalwood, saffron, camphor, and agarwood powder equal to Mount Meru, with all these

original: bkod pa'i khyad par 'phags pa mchog kun gyis /
analyzed: bkod pa'i khyad par 'phags pa mchog kun gyis /
translated: with all the most excellent and sublime arrays.

original: zhes bya ba la bkod ces bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir tshogs pa'i rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la bkod ces bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir tshogs pa'i rnam grangs yin te /
translated: Here the word array is a synonym for collection.

original: lha dang mi'i rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa dag gis rgyal ba thams cad la mchod par bgyi'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa dag gis rgyal ba thams cad la mchod par bgyi'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: With all the best of divine and human forms, we will make offerings to all the victors.

original: bla na med pa ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa ni /
translated: Unsurpassed means

original: mchod pa gang rnams bla med zhes bya ba la bstan te /
analyzed: mchod pa gang rnams bla med zhes bya ba la bstan te /
translated: The worship that is called “unsurpassed” is taught.

original: mchod pa gang rnams bla na med cing rgya che ba byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyi mthus bskyed pa /
analyzed: mchod pa gang rnams bla na med cing rgya che ba byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyi mthus bskyed pa /
translated: The worship that is unsurpassed and vast, generated by the power of the special meditative concentration of the bodhisattva,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par /
translated: pervades the entire realm of phenomena,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rgyas par 'gengs pa de dag bdag gis rgyal ba thams cad la yid kyis mos par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rgyas par 'gengs pa de dag bdag gis rgyal ba thams cad la yid kyis mos par bya'o //
translated: and fills all buddha-fields. I mentally aspire to that.

original: bzang po spyod la dad pa'i stobs dag gis //
analyzed: bzang po spyod la dad pa'i stobs dag gis //
translated: With the power of faith in the good way of life,

original: zhes bya ba ni bzang po spyod pa la dad pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bzang po spyod pa la dad pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This means “with the power of faith in the good way of life.”

original: bzang po spyod la dad pa ni mos pa dang / yid ches pa dang / nges pa yin no //
analyzed: bzang po spyod la dad pa ni mos pa dang / yid ches pa dang / nges pa yin no //
translated: Faith in the good way of life is aspiration, confidence, and certainty.

original: de'i stobs kyis te bzang po spyod pa de'i mchod pa ni mdo sde du ma las kyang byang chub sems dpa' sprul pa'i mchod pa 'byung bar de lta bu dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis te bzang po spyod pa de'i mchod pa ni mdo sde du ma las kyang byang chub sems dpa' sprul pa'i mchod pa 'byung bar de lta bu dag yin no //
translated: By the power of that, the worship of that good way of life is like that which appears in many sūtras as the worship of emanated bodhisattvas.

original: da ni ji skad bshad pa'i phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod pa dag mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ji skad bshad pa'i phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod pa dag mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to conclude the homage and offering as they have been explained,🔽he says,

original: rgyal ba kun la phyag 'tshal mchod par bgyi //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyal ba kun la phyag 'tshal mchod par bgyi // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: I pay homage to and make offerings to all the victors.

original: rgyal ba thams cad la phyag 'tshal bar bgyi zhing mchod par bgyi'o //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyal ba thams cad la phyag 'tshal bar bgyi zhing mchod par bgyi'o // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: I pay homage to and make offerings to all the victors.

original: da ni ngo bo nyid dang gzhi dang rten dang rnam pa gsum gyis sdig pa bshags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ngo bo nyid dang gzhi dang rten dang rnam pa gsum gyis sdig pa bshags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the confession of evil by way of the three, essence, basis, and support,🔽he says,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug dbang gis na /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug dbang gis na /
translated: Through the power of attachment, hostility, and ignorance,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas bdag gi tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan dag @236b du sdig pa bgyis pa dang / bgyid du stsal ba dang bgyis pa la rjes su yi rang ba ci mchis pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas bdag gi tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan dag @236b du sdig pa bgyis pa dang / bgyid du stsal ba dang bgyis pa la rjes su yi rang ba ci mchis pa'o //
translated: Therein, by way of essence, whatever evil I have done in this life and in other lives, caused others to do, or rejoiced in,

original: gzhi ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the basis?

original: gzhi ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug go //
analyzed: gzhi ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug go //
translated: The basis is attachment, hostility, and ignorance.

original: rten gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rten gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the support?

original: rten ni lus dang ngag dang yid yin te /
analyzed: rten ni lus dang ngag dang yid yin te /
translated: The support is the body, speech, and mind.🔽All of those are like sitting in the presence of all the Victors and their sons.

original: de dag thams cad rgyal ba sras dang bcas pa kun gyi spyan sngar 'dug pa dang 'dra bar shin du 'gyod pa'i yid kyis /
analyzed: de dag thams cad rgyal ba sras dang bcas pa kun gyi spyan sngar 'dug pa dang 'dra bar shin du 'gyod pa'i yid kyis /
translated: With a mind of great regret,

original: skad cig re re la so sor bshags shing bsal bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: skad cig re re la so sor bshags shing bsal bar bgyi'o //
translated: I confess and clear away each and every one of them, moment by moment.

original: da ni bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach rejoicing in merit,

original: phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “In the ten directions,” and so on.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'gro ba kun gyis sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams dus gsum pa gang lags pa dang slob pa gang zag bdun po rnams kyi gang lags pa dang / mi slob pa dgra bcom pa rnams kyi gang lags pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'gro ba kun gyis sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams dus gsum pa gang lags pa dang slob pa gang zag bdun po rnams kyi gang lags pa dang / mi slob pa dgra bcom pa rnams kyi gang lags pa dang /
translated: Whatever merit there is of giving, morality, and meditation by all migrating beings in the ten directions, in the three times, whatever there is of the seven types of learners, whatever there is of the non-learners, the arhats,

original: rang rgyal ba rnam pa gnyis po bse ru lta bu dang / tshogs shing spyod pa rnams kyi bsod nams 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dus gsum pa gang lags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ba gang lags pa dang /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus gsum du gtogs pa rnams re re zhing brdar btags pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ye shes la sogs pa las bskyed pa 'jig rten pa dang /
analyzed: rang rgyal ba rnam pa gnyis po bse ru lta bu dang / tshogs shing spyod pa rnams kyi bsod nams 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dus gsum pa gang lags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ba gang lags pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dus gsum du gtogs pa rnams re re zhing brdar btags pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ye shes la sogs pa las bskyed pa 'jig rten pa dang /
translated: I rejoice in the merit of the two types of solitary realizers, those who are like a rhinoceros and those who gather in groups, the mundane and supramundane merit of the three times, and that of all bodhisattvas from the first generation of bodhichitta onward.🔽I rejoice in the merit of each and every one of the bhagavan buddhas of the three times, from the first generation of bodhichitta up to the accumulation of merit and wisdom and so forth, the mundane and supramundane merit of the three times, which is beyond measure and inconceivable and the domain of the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa dus gsum du gtogs pa tshad med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi spyod yul gang lags pa de dag thams cad la bdag skad cig re re zhing rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa dus gsum du gtogs pa tshad med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi spyod yul gang lags pa de dag thams cad la bdag skad cig re re zhing rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: I rejoice in all of these, moment by moment.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ma lus pa la snyegs pa'i phyir slob pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyang nang du 'du bar 'grub na /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ma lus pa la snyegs pa'i phyir slob pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyang nang du 'du bar 'grub na /
translated: The term “world” is applied to all, so it is established that the merit of the learners and so on is included within it.

original: ci'i phyir logs shig tu smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir logs shig tu smos she na /
translated: Why then is it mentioned separately?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'gro bas na 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro bas na 'gro ba ste /
translated: Because it goes, it is a world.

original: sred pa dang bcas pas 'khor bar shin du 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sred pa dang bcas pas 'khor bar shin du 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a world because it goes in cyclic existence with craving.

original: de la kha cig ni shin du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang kha cig ni 'gro ba yang med pa'i phyir 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod du mi @237a * //
analyzed: de la kha cig ni shin du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang kha cig ni 'gro ba yang med pa'i phyir 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod du mi @237a * //
translated: Some are not suitable to be called a world because they do not go anywhere, and some are not suitable to be called a world because they do not go at all.

original: rung bas so sor bstan to //
analyzed: rung bas so sor bstan to //
translated: Therefore they are taught separately.

original: da ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul bar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gang rnams phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten sgron ma dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul bar bstan pa'i phyir / gang rnams phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten sgron ma dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the urging of the turning of the wheel of Dharma,🔽it is said:🔽Those who are the lamps of the worlds of the ten directions,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi sgron ma ni 'gro ba'i sgron ma gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi sgron ma ni 'gro ba'i sgron ma gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: The lamps of the worlds of the ten directions are those who are the lamps of migrating beings.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten gyi phyi dang nang gi mun pa mang po sel ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi sgron ma'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten gyi phyi dang nang gi mun pa mang po sel ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi sgron ma'o //
translated: The Buddhas, the Venerable Ones, are the light of the world, because they are by nature the dispellers of the many internal and external obscurations of the world.

original: byang chub rim par zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas so //
analyzed: byang chub rim par zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas so //
translated: In the stages of enlightenment, means having attained supreme enlightenment.

original: ma chags brnyes zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ma chags brnyes zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa nyid du gyur pa ste /
translated: Having attained without attachment, means having become without attachment.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i stobs kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma lus par yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i stobs kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma lus par yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of the power of enlightenment, he has completely understood the nature of all things, and so he is not beyond all attachment.

original: chos zab mo rtogs par bya ba yang don du mi gnyer zhing mngon par mi brtson pa gzhan dag gis khong du chud par dka' 'o zhes chos 'chad par mi spro zhing 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs na byang chub kyi zhing dam pa'i drung na bzhugs pa
analyzed: chos zab mo rtogs par bya ba yang don du mi gnyer zhing mngon par mi brtson pa gzhan dag gis khong du chud par dka' 'o zhes chos 'chad par mi spro zhing 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs na byang chub kyi zhing dam pa'i drung na bzhugs pa
translated: In various world systems, in the presence of the holy fields of enlightenment,

original: gang dag lags pa 'jig rten gyi mgon po de dag thams cad la /
analyzed: gang dag lags pa 'jig rten gyi mgon po de dag thams cad la /
translated: all those who are the protectors of the world,

original: 'gro ba'i mi shes pa'i mdun pa bsal zhing bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba 'byung bar bya ba'i ched du /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mi shes pa'i mdun pa bsal zhing bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba 'byung bar bya ba'i ched du /
translated: in order to dispel the darkness of ignorance of beings and to give rise to the light of unsurpassed wisdom,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bla na med pa bskor ba'i phyir re re'i spyan snga na bdag pus mos la btsugs te thal mo sbyar nas 'dug bzhin du bskul lo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bla na med pa bskor ba'i phyir re re'i spyan snga na bdag pus mos la btsugs te thal mo sbyar nas 'dug bzhin du bskul lo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: I stand before each one of them, kneeling with palms joined, and beseech them to turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bzhugs par gsol ba ni /🔽mya ngan 'da' ston gang bzhed de dag la //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bzhugs par gsol ba ni / mya ngan 'da' ston gang bzhed de dag la //
translated: The request for the Tathagatas to remain is

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: as stated in the lines:🔽To those who wish to demonstrate nirvana,🔽I beseech them to remain for countless eons.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni bye brag ma phye ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni bye brag ma phye ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the term whatever is a general reference,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi sgron ma zhes bya ba kho na dang sbyar te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi sgron ma zhes bya ba kho na dang sbyar te /
translated: it is connected only with the phrase lamps of the worlds in the ten directions.

original: phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa ston par bzhed pa de dag thams cad la yun ring du bzhugs par bdag gsol zhes don du gnyer ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa ston par bzhed pa de dag thams cad la yun ring du bzhugs par bdag gsol zhes don du gnyer ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It means that I request all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who are in the ten directions and are about to demonstrate nirvana, to remain for a long time.

original: dus ji srid cig tu zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu zhe na /
translated: For how long a time?

original: dus gsum du gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul thams cad dang mnyam pa'i bskal par bzhugs par ro //
analyzed: dus gsum du gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul thams cad dang mnyam pa'i bskal par bzhugs par ro //
translated: For eons equal to the number of atoms in all the buddha-fields throughout the three times.

original: @237b ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @237b ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'gro ba mgon med pa thams cad la phan zhing bde bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gro ba mgon med pa thams cad la phan zhing bde bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: For the sake of all beings who are without a protector, for their benefit and happiness.

original: de la phan pa ni shin tu grub pa dang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de la phan pa ni shin tu grub pa dang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam thob pa yin no //
translated: Therein, benefit is the attainment of the path to nirvana, which is complete well-being.

original: bde ba ni lha'i rmad du byung ba brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni lha'i rmad du byung ba brnyes pa'o //
translated: Happiness is the attainment of the marvelous state of a god.

original: da ni ji skad bstan pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po phyag 'tshal la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: da ni ji skad bstan pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po phyag 'tshal la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba'i yongs su bsngo ba ni /
translated: Now, the dedication of the mass of merit as taught, which is produced by the worship, etc.,

original: phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod cing bshags pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod cing bshags pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is stated in the verse, “I pay homage, make offerings, and confess, etc.”

original: phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod pa dang sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs par gsol ba'i dge ba cung zad bdag gis bsags shing bsgrubs pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod pa dang sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs par gsol ba'i dge ba cung zad bdag gis bsags shing bsgrubs pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The virtue that I have accumulated and accomplished, by paying homage, making offerings, confessing evil, rejoicing in merit, requesting the wheel of the Dharma to be turned, and requesting the Tathagatas to remain, all of that I dedicate to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de ni de'i rab tu dbye ba ste brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i rab tu dbye ba ste brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth division.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam de yan lag tu rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam de yan lag tu rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: Its division is the division into members of the prayer for the conduct of Samantabhadra.

original: de yang rnam pa bcu drug ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bcu drug ste 'di lta ste /

translated: The thought of making offerings to the Tathagatas and fulfilling their intentions is expressed by the words “to the Buddhas of the past, etc.”

analyzed: mchod par gyur ces bya ba ni bla na med pa'i mchod pa ste /

translated: To the Blessed Buddhas who have demonstrated nirvana, and to those who are now dwelling and maintaining the worlds in the ten directions,🔽and who are intent on bringing about the benefit and happiness of all beings,🔽in the same way, may offerings be made to them.

original: dag la phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa lhur mdzad pa gang dag yin pa de dag la yang de bzhin du mchod bar gyur cig / ma 'ongs pa na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag kyang thugs la dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs nas

translated: And to those who will appear in the future, may their intentions be fulfilled,

original: myur du thogs pa med par byang chub rnam par sangs rgyas par spyon cig ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: myur du thogs pa med par byang chub rnam par sangs rgyas par spyon cig ces bya ba yin te /
translated: and may they quickly and unobstructedly arrive at the enlightenment of perfect Buddhahood.

original: phyed gong mas ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i bsams pa bstan to //
analyzed: phyed gong mas ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i bsams pa bstan to //
translated: The first half of the verse shows the thought of worship of the Tathagata.

original: phyed 'og mas ni dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsam pa bstan to //
analyzed: phyed 'og mas ni dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsam pa bstan to //
translated: The second half shows the thought of fulfillment of the vow.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba'i bsam pa ni /
translated: The thought of purification of the Buddha-field is shown in the verse beginning:

original: phyogs bcu ga la'i zhing rnams ji snyed pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /🔽ga la'i zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu ga la'i zhing rnams ji snyed pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te / ga la'i zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: “However many fields there are in the ten directions.”

original: ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni ci yod pa ste /
analyzed: ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni ci yod pa ste /
translated: “However many” means whatever there are.

original: phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad re re zhing yang dpag tu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gtos lta bur rgya che zhing yangs pa dang / bde ba can lta bur yongs su dag par gyur la /
analyzed: phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad re re zhing yang dpag tu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gtos lta bur rgya che zhing yangs pa dang / bde ba can lta bur yongs su dag par gyur la /
translated: Whatever Buddha-fields there are in the ten directions, each one of them is vast and extensive like the whole of the immeasurable world-realm, and is purified like the Blissful Buddha-field.

original: byang chub kyi shing gi dbang po'i drung du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kun nas yongs su gang zhing /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing gi dbang po'i drung du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kun nas yongs su gang zhing /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who have gone to the foot of the Bodhi tree, and the Bodhisattvas, fill and completely cover the place.

original: bar mtshams med par khyab par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bar mtshams med par khyab par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: May they be without interval or interruption.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni /
translated: The intention to benefit and to bring happiness to all beings:

original: phyogs bcu'i sems can gang rnams ji snyed pa //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sems can gang rnams ji snyed pa //
translated: All the beings in the ten directions,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: as many as there are,

original: phyogs bcu'i sems can 'gro ba lnga po skye gnas bzhis bsdus pa gang yang rung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par lus dang sems kyi nad dang bral zhing med par gyur la /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sems can 'gro ba lnga po skye gnas bzhis bsdus pa gang yang rung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par lus dang sems kyi nad dang bral zhing med par gyur la /
translated: The beings in the ten directions, in the five destinies, included in the four modes of birth, as many as there are, may they always be without interruption, free from the sickness of body and mind.

original: ngan song ba ma yin pa'i bde ba mchog gis bde bar gyur cig / de dag gi chos dang mthun pa'i don rnyed pa gang yin pa de yang mthun zhing 'cham par gyur la /

translated: And may they find the meaning that is in accord with the Dharma, and may they be in accord with it and harmonious.

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi chos dang mthun pa'i bsam pa yang rtag tu 'grub cing 'byor bar shog cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi chos dang mthun pa'i bsam pa yang rtag tu 'grub cing 'byor bar shog cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: May the intention of all beings that is in accord with the Dharma always be accomplished and fulfilled.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gnyen po dang bcas pa bstan nas /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba gnyen po dang bcas pa bstan nas /
translated: In four verses, he has explained the avoidance of counteragents together with the antidotes.

original: rnam pa gnyis ba byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa bshad de /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ba byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa bshad de /
translated: Now, in order to explain the second aspect, the non-forgetting of the Thought of Enlightenment, he says:

original: byang chub spyod pa @238b dag ni bdag spyod cing //
analyzed: byang chub spyod pa @238b dag ni bdag spyod cing //
translated: I shall practice the conduct of enlightenment

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: de dag ma lus yongs su byang bar shog / ces bya ba'i bar gang gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo /
translated: Enlightenment is the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i ched du spyod pa ni byang chub spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ched du spyod pa ni byang chub spyod pa ste /
translated: The conduct for the sake of that is the conduct of enlightenment.

analyzed: de bdag spyod cing sgrub la 'gro pa thams cad du skye ba dran par gyur cig / tshe rabs thams cad du 'chi 'pho skye ba ste 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba na yang bdag rtag tu rab tu 'byung bar shog cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: And in all lives, at death, at birth, at death and birth, may I always be ordained.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dag gi bar gyi gnas skabs ni shugs kyis bstan pa kho nar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dag gi bar gyi gnas skabs ni shugs kyis bstan pa kho nar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The state between death and birth should be understood as taught by implication.

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa'i rgyu dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first cause of not forgetting the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du /

translated: Similarly,

analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyi rjes su slob gyur te // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: I will train in the practice of all the Victors.

original: dus gsum du gtogs pa'i rgyal ba thams cad kyi bslab pa'i rjes su slob par gyur te'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du gtogs pa'i rgyal ba thams cad kyi bslab pa'i rjes su slob par gyur te'o //
translated: Here, “practice of all the Victors” means training in the practice of all the Victors belonging to the three times.

original: bzang po spyod pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa bzang bo'o //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa bzang bo'o //
translated: “Good practice” means good practice.

analyzed: yongs su rdzogs byed cing zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs shing mthar phyin par byed pa'o //
translated: “Fully perfecting” means perfecting and completing.

original: ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is done?

original: tshul khrims spyod pa dri med yongs dag pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims spyod pa dri med yongs dag pa /
translated: The conduct of pure morality is completely purified.

original: rtag tu ma nyams skyon med spyod par shog / ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtag tu ma nyams skyon med spyod par shog / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: May I always practice without decline or fault.

original: dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, a wish-fulfilling jewel is free from adventitious stains,

analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyis dri ma med pa /
translated: and because of being free from stains, it is stainless.

original: g-ya'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: g-ya'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is free from the fault of rust,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: it is naturally completely pure.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma nyams shing skyon med la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma nyams shing skyon med la /
translated: For that very reason, it is without decline or fault,🔽and

analyzed: sems can gyi 'dod pa phun sum tshogs par byed pa dang / yongs su gdung ba thams cad sel ba dang / nad thams cad dang bral ba dang / dus ma yin par 'chi ba rab tu zhi bar byed pa lta bur gzhan gyi don sgrub pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims kyang rin po che bzhin du rin po che yin te /
translated: Just as the wish-fulfilling gem fulfills the wishes of sentient beings, dispels all their anguish, frees them from all sickness and pacifies all untimely death, in the same way, the bodhisattvas' discipline is like a gem.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa glo bur ba dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyis dri ma med la /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa glo bur ba dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyis dri ma med la /
translated: It is stainless, free of stains, because it is unadulterated with adventitious karma and defilements.

translated: It is pure, because it is free of the stains of the faults of the listeners and solitary realizers' states of mind and because it arises from the precious cause, the first generation of bodhichitta, which is the indispensable cause of omniscience.

original: kun nas yongs su dag pas na yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas yongs su dag pas na yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is completely pure because it is utterly pure.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad la gus par byed pa nyid kyis ltung ba kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir bslab pa ma nyams pa'i sgo nas ma nyams shing /

translated: It is like the earth because it is the basis of all the qualities of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bzhi po de dag gis ni byang chub kyi sems kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i sgrib pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi gnyen po bstan pa yin no //

translated: These four and a half verses teach the antidotes to the obscurations that are adverse to the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, in half a verse, he teaches the abandonment of the adverse:

original: sdig pa gang rnams sgrib par gyur pa dag //
analyzed: sdig pa gang rnams sgrib par gyur pa dag //
translated: Whatever sins have become obscurations

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: and so on.

original: sdig pa sgrib par gyur pa byang chub kyi sems kyi bar chad byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag ma lus par thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su byang zhing spong bar shog shig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa sgrib par gyur pa byang chub kyi sems kyi bar chad byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag ma lus par thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su byang zhing spong bar shog shig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Whatever sins have become obscurations, which are obstacles to the Thought of Enlightenment, may all of them, all of them, be completely purified and abandoned.

original: da ni gang las dang / gang du dang / ji ltar zhes rgyu gsum gyis rnam pa gsum pa chags pa med par sbyor ba ston pa ste /
analyzed: da ni gang las dang / gang du dang / ji ltar zhes rgyu gsum gyis rnam pa gsum pa chags pa med par sbyor ba ston pa ste /
translated: Now, in three causes, he teaches the three kinds of application without attachment: from what, where, and how.

original: las dang nyon mongs bdud kyi las rnams las //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs bdud kyi las rnams las //
translated: From the actions, the afflictions, the works of Mara,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gang las zhe na /
analyzed: gang las zhe na /
translated: From what?

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi lam las so //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi lam las so //
translated: From the paths of karma, afflictions, and demons.

original: las 'di yang bye brag tu ma phye ba'i phyir dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i khyad par gyis rnam pa gsum char bzung ste /
analyzed: las 'di yang bye brag tu ma phye ba'i phyir dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i khyad par gyis rnam pa gsum char bzung ste /
translated: And this karma is taken as all three types, because it is not distinguished, by way of the distinctions of virtue, nonvirtue, and the imperturbable.

original: de las mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las rnams las grol zhing de dag gis mi chags par rtag tu spyad do //
analyzed: de las mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las rnams las grol zhing de dag gis mi chags par rtag tu spyad do //
translated: From among those, he is always engaged in being free from nonvirtuous karma, afflictions, and the works of demons, and is not attached to them.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: 'jig rten 'gro ba rnams su ste lha la sogs pa'i nang du'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'gro ba rnams su ste lha la sogs pa'i nang du'o //
translated: In the migrations of the world, among gods and so forth.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: How?

original: ji ltar padma chus mi chags pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar padma chus mi chags pa bzhin //
translated: Like a lotus is not attached to water.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ji ltar padma chu las skyes pa chus mi chags pa de bzhin du sdig pa'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / bdud kyi lam 'jig rten gyi chos dag gis ma gos par spyod pa spyad do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar padma chu las skyes pa chus mi chags pa de bzhin du sdig pa'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / bdud kyi lam 'jig rten gyi chos dag gis ma gos par spyod pa spyad do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as a lotus born from the water is not attached to the water and is not soiled by the water, in the same way, he practices the bodhisattva practices without being soiled by evil actions, afflictions, or the worldly paths of Mara.

original: de bzhin du las dge ba dang mi g-yo ba dag la yang mi chags shing 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la mi lta bar 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir spyad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du las dge ba dang mi g-yo ba dag la yang mi chags shing 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la mi lta bar 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir spyad de /
translated: In the same way, he practices the virtuous and unwavering actions without attachment and without regard for the results that would ripen. He practices only in order to generate benefit and happiness for all beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba yin no //🔽de bzhin du las dge ba dang mi g-yo ba dag la yang mi chags shing 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la mi lta bar 'gro ba mtha' dag la @240a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba yin no // de bzhin du las dge ba dang mi g-yo ba dag la yang mi chags shing 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la mi lta bar 'gro ba mtha' dag la @240a * //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva practice.

original: phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir spyad de /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir spyad de /
translated: In the same way, he practices the virtuous and unwavering actions without attachment and without regard for the results that would ripen. He practices only in order to generate benefit and happiness for all beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba kho nas drang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba kho nas drang ngo //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva practice.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: nyi zla nam mkhar thogs pa med ltar spyad //🔽ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyi zla nam mkhar thogs pa med ltar spyad // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Like the sun and moon moving through the sky, he practices.

original: dper na nyi ma dang zla ba dag 'jig rten na yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du gzhan gyi don byed pa la ro gcig tu zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma dang zla ba dag 'jig rten na yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du gzhan gyi don byed pa la ro gcig tu zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the sun and moon are like wish-fulfilling gems for the world, because they are engaged in the single taste of benefiting others.

original: rang gi don la cung zad kyang ma chags par nyin mtshan du nam mkha' la rgyu ba de dang 'dra bar ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don la cung zad kyang ma chags par nyin mtshan du nam mkha' la rgyu ba de dang 'dra bar ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Without the slightest attachment to their own purpose, they move through the sky day and night.

original: de la bdud ces bya ba ni dge ba'i bar chad byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la bdud ces bya ba ni dge ba'i bar chad byed pa ste /
translated: Mara means an obstacle to virtue.

original: byang chub kyi lam 'gog cing yang dag pa'i lam zlog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam 'gog cing yang dag pa'i lam zlog par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the obstruction of the path to enlightenment and the turning away from the true path.

original: nges pa'i tshig tu chos kyi srog gi bar chad byed pa yin pas gsod pa'i phyir bdud ces bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig tu chos kyi srog gi bar chad byed pa yin pas gsod pa'i phyir bdud ces bya'o //
translated: In etymological explanation, it is called Mara because it kills by creating obstacles to the life of the Dharma.

original: de'i lam ni phan pa'i dngos po la rgyus 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: de'i lam ni phan pa'i dngos po la rgyus 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Its path is the harm caused by the cause of benefit.

original: rnam pa bzhi pa tshe 'di dang phyi mar sems can ma lus pa la phan gdags pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi pa tshe 'di dang phyi mar sems can ma lus pa la phan gdags pa ni /
translated: The fourth aspect is the benefit for all sentient beings in this life and the next.

original: zhing gi khyon dang phyogs rnams ji tsam par //🔽ngan song sdug bsngal thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhing gi khyon dang phyogs rnams ji tsam par // ngan song sdug bsngal thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: As many as are the reaches of the fields and directions,🔽all the sufferings of the lower realms of beings are pacified.

original: 'gro ba'i ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal ngan 'gro gsum las byung ba de dag thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed cing ngo //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal ngan 'gro gsum las byung ba de dag thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed cing ngo //
translated: The sufferings of the lower realms of beings are those that arise from the three lower realms.

original: yang ci'i phyir na ngan song gi sdug bsngal dag kho na rab tu zhi ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir na ngan song gi sdug bsngal dag kho na rab tu zhi ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are only the sufferings of the lower realms pacified?

original: de dag gis ni shin tu gnod par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gtsor smos par zad kyi /
analyzed: de dag gis ni shin tu gnod par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gtsor smos par zad kyi /
translated: They are mentioned primarily because they are extremely harmful.

original: 'khor ba ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed cing zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed cing zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: But it should be understood that all the sufferings of cyclic existence are pacified.

original: de bzhin du 'gro ba thams cad bde ba'i mchog la yang 'god cing zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro ba thams cad bde ba'i mchog la yang 'god cing zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, all beings are established in the highest bliss.

original: ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is done?

original: 'gro ba thams cad la phan par bya zhing phan pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la phan par bya zhing phan pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is done in order to benefit all beings and to generate benefit.

original: bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i bar du yid yongs su skye ba med pas gzhan du mi sbyor bar spyad cing 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i bar du yid yongs su skye ba med pas gzhan du mi sbyor bar spyad cing 'bad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice and strive without applying oneself elsewhere, because the mind is not produced in any other way, up to the attainment of unsurpassed pristine awareness.

original: dus ji srid cig tu zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu zhe na /
translated: For how long a time?

original: zhing gi khyon dang phyogs rnams ji tsam par //
analyzed: zhing gi khyon dang phyogs rnams ji tsam par //
translated: As many as are the atoms in the fields,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /🔽phyogs rnams na zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu na'o /🔽ji tsam par zhes bya ba ni ji srid par ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / phyogs rnams na zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu na'o / ji tsam par zhes bya ba ni ji srid par ro //
translated: in the directions.🔽As many as are the atoms in the fields, in the buddha-fields, in the buddha-fields of the ten directions.

original: zhing gi khyon ces bya bar ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyun te bskal pa brgyud bar rgyun @240b 'byung ba ji srid pa de srid du spyad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhing gi khyon ces bya bar ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyun te bskal pa brgyud bar rgyun @240b 'byung ba ji srid pa de srid du spyad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For that long, for that long a time, one should practice.

original: rnam pa lnga pa ni go cha'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga pa ni go cha'o //
translated: The fifth aspect is armor.

original: de yang sems can gyi spyod pa dang mthun par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos rab tu ston pa dang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang sems can gyi spyod pa dang mthun par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos rab tu ston pa dang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: And that is threefold: engaging in accordance with the conduct of sentient beings, bringing the qualities of the Buddha to completion, and teaching the sublime Dharma.

original: byang chub spyod pa yongs su rdzogs byed cing //
analyzed: byang chub spyod pa yongs su rdzogs byed cing //
translated: And they perfect the practice of enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi ched du spyod pa ni byang chub spyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi ched du spyod pa ni byang chub spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice for the sake of enlightenment is the practice of enlightenment.

original: de yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: They perfect it.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams skyed par byed cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams skyed par byed cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They generate the qualities of a Buddha. This is the meaning.

original: sems can dag gi spyod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can dag gi spyod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And they know the conduct of beings.

original: tshe rabs thams cad du sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa kun shes par byas nas /
analyzed: tshe rabs thams cad du sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa kun shes par byas nas /
translated: Having understood the conduct of the minds of beings in all their lives,

original: rang bzhin gyis g-yo med pa dang / 'grogs na bde ba dang mi mthun pa med pa'i ngo bos de dag dang mthun par 'jug cing ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis g-yo med pa dang / 'grogs na bde ba dang mi mthun pa med pa'i ngo bos de dag dang mthun par 'jug cing ngo //
translated: they engage in conduct that is in accord with them, by nature free of deceit, and with a nature that is pleasant and without conflict.

original: bzang po spyod pa dag ni rab ston cing //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa dag ni rab ston cing //
translated: And they reveal the practice of goodness.

original: zhes bya ba la bzang po spyod pa ni 'dir rab tu ston par brjod par bzhed pa yin pas chos ston pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bzung ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la bzang po spyod pa ni 'dir rab tu ston par brjod par bzhed pa yin pas chos ston pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bzung ste //
translated: Here, the practice of goodness is taken to have the nature of teaching the Dharma, because it is intended to be an expression of teaching well.

original: de mngon par rjod par byed pa'i tshig dag la bzang po spyod pa nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon par rjod par byed pa'i tshig dag la bzang po spyod pa nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the words that express it are designated as the “good practice.”

original: tshig de 'gro ba la rab tu ston cing ste yang dag par rab tu ston la 'chad cing ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa phyi ma'i mthar skyo ba med pa'i yid kyis spyod par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig de 'gro ba la rab tu ston cing ste yang dag par rab tu ston la 'chad cing ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa phyi ma'i mthar skyo ba med pa'i yid kyis spyod par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: He shows, i.e., teaches, those words to beings, and explains them, with a mind that is never wearied, until the end of the future, i.e., in all future eons.

original: rnam pa drug pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa'i smon lam dag gis skal ba mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang phrad pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa drug pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa'i smon lam dag gis skal ba mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang phrad pa ni /
translated: The prayer for the concordant group of Bodhisattvas with the six aspects of physical, verbal, and mental practice is:

original: bdag gi spyod dang mthun par gang spyod pa //
analyzed: bdag gi spyod dang mthun par gang spyod pa //
translated: “May I always practice in accord with them.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is stated, and so forth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag bdag gi spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la spyod pas mtshungs shing 'dra ba de dag dang bdag byang chub kyi bar du rtag tu lhan cig phrad cing 'grogs par shog shig ces pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyis de dag kho na dang lhan cig kun nas nyon mongs pa med ba'i gnas pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gcig pa dang smon lam gcig tu spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag bdag gi spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la spyod pas mtshungs shing 'dra ba de dag dang bdag byang chub kyi bar du rtag tu lhan cig phrad cing 'grogs par shog shig ces pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyis de dag kho na dang lhan cig kun nas nyon mongs pa med ba'i gnas pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gcig pa dang smon lam gcig tu spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And with them, with my body, speech, and mind, I will practice the bodhisattva conduct and the same aspirations, with a dwelling free of afflictions.

original: rnam pa bdun pa phan par sems pa'i gdams ngag sgrub pa dag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen mgu bar byed @241a * //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun pa phan par sems pa'i gdams ngag sgrub pa dag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen mgu bar byed @241a * //
translated: The seventh kind of pleasing the spiritual friend is by accomplishing the advice that is given with a mind of helpfulness.

original: pa ni / bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs po gang //
analyzed: pa ni / bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs po gang //
translated: The spiritual friend who wishes to help me

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: and so on.

original: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs po dge ba'i bshes gnyen bzang po spyod pa ston cing 'chad par byed pa chos smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag dang rtag tu 'grogs shing phrad pa dang de dag rnams kyang res 'ga' yang cung zad kyang yid mi
analyzed: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs po dge ba'i bshes gnyen bzang po spyod pa ston cing 'chad par byed pa chos smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag dang rtag tu 'grogs shing phrad pa dang de dag rnams kyang res 'ga' yang cung zad kyang yid mi
translated: May I never displease them in any way,

original: 'byung zhing byang chub kyi bar du dus thams cad du mthun par 'jug par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byung zhing byang chub kyi bar du dus thams cad du mthun par 'jug par gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: and may I always be in harmony with them until enlightenment.

original: rnam pa brgyad pa 'khor dang dus dang mi skyo ba dang mchod pa'i bya ba dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bya ba ni /🔽sangs rgyas sras kyis bskor ba'i mgon po rnams //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad pa 'khor dang dus dang mi skyo ba dang mchod pa'i bya ba dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bya ba ni / sangs rgyas sras kyis bskor ba'i mgon po rnams //
translated: The eighth aspect is that of making the tathagatas directly perceptible through one's retinue, one's time and one's indefatigability in making offerings.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The ninth aspect is that of the attitude of being like a child.🔽The tenth aspect is that of the attitude of being like a servant.

original: phyogs bcu kun gyi rgyal ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba'i mgon po 'gro ba'i gnyen gcig pu la thogs pa med pa'i mig gis rtag tu mngon sum du lhag ger blta zhing de dag re re la yang skad cig la
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun gyi rgyal ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba'i mgon po 'gro ba'i gnyen gcig pu la thogs pa med pa'i mig gis rtag tu mngon sum du lhag ger blta zhing de dag re re la yang skad cig la
translated: And to each of them, in every instant,

original: mchod pa rgya chen po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa nam mkha'i gtos dang mnyam zhing chos kyi dbyings khyab pas mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mchod pa rgya chen po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa nam mkha'i gtos dang mnyam zhing chos kyi dbyings khyab pas mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: make vast offerings endowed with the most sublime aspects, equal to the reaches of space, pervading the expanse of reality.

original: dus ji srid cig tu zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu zhe na /
translated: For how long a period of time?

original: ma 'ongs bskal pa kun du mi skyo bar //
analyzed: ma 'ongs bskal pa kun du mi skyo bar //
translated: For all future eons, without tiring.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

original: ji ltar zhe na /

original: de'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / dmigs pa ni gang la byang chub kyi sems mi skye ba dang / gang la sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar smon par mi 'gyur bas de med de /

original: 'dis theg pas ni theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis theg pas ni theg pa'o //

analyzed: de ni theg pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na theg pa chen po'o //

analyzed: yang na theg pa chen po sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi theg pa yin pas na theg pa chen po'o //

original: 'di'i rang bzhin ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin ci yin zhe na /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob par byed pa'i lam bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'o //

original: yang na theg pa chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na theg pa chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Or, the Great Vehicle is endowed with the perfections.

original: de'i stobs ni thogs pa med pa nyid de mi mthun pa'i phyogs las nges par rgyal pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i stobs ni thogs pa med pa nyid de mi mthun pa'i phyogs las nges par rgyal pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: kun du yon tan zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang bar dang tha mar dge ba'o //
translated: It is endowed with virtues, which means that it is virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: spyod pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu ma byas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i stobs dang / bzang po spyod pa'i stobs te /
analyzed: spyod pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu ma byas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i stobs dang / bzang po spyod pa'i stobs te /
translated: The power of practice is the power of the bodhisattva practice, and the power of good practice, because they are not distinguished.

original: spyod pa gnyi ga'i stobs kyis so //

original: kun du khyab pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcur khyab pa'o //
analyzed: kun du khyab pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcur khyab pa'o //
translated: It is all-pervading, because it pervades the ten directions.

analyzed: byams pa dag gi stobs zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams thams cad la bde bar sems pas khyab pa'o //
translated: It is the power of love, because it pervades the whole realm of sentient beings with the intention to make them happy.

original: kun du dge ba zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la phan @245b pa dang / bde ba bskyed pa'i bsam pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du dge ba zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la phan @245b pa dang / bde ba bskyed pa'i bsam pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is all-virtuous, because it accomplishes the intention to generate benefit and happiness for all sentient beings.

original: bsod nams stobs zhes bya ba ni dag cing gtsang bar byed pas na bsod nams so //
analyzed: bsod nams stobs zhes bya ba ni dag cing gtsang bar byed pas na bsod nams so //
translated: It is the power of merit, because it is merit, being pure and bright.

original: yang na phyi phyir legs par 'gyur bas na bsod nams so //
analyzed: yang na phyi phyir legs par 'gyur bas na bsod nams so //
translated: Or it is merit, because it is good again and again.

original: de'i stobs ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa bsgoms pa las 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i stobs ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa bsgoms pa las 'gyur te /
translated: Its power comes from the cultivation of the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: byang chub sems kyi bsod nams gang //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi bsod nams gang //
translated: What is the merit of the thought of enlightenment?

original: de ni gal te gzugs can gyur //
analyzed: de ni gal te gzugs can gyur //
translated: If it were to become material,

original: nam mkha'i khams kun bkang nas ni //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kun bkang nas ni //
translated: it would fill the whole realm of space,

original: de bas kyang ni de lhag gyur //🔽de bzhin du theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i chos zab cing rgya che ba 'dzin pa dang klog pa dang 'chad pa dang mos pa dang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis 'dzin pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba las kyang 'gyur te bsod nams kyi stobs des so //
analyzed: de bas kyang ni de lhag gyur // de bzhin du theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i chos zab cing rgya che ba 'dzin pa dang klog pa dang 'chad pa dang mos pa dang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis 'dzin pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba las kyang 'gyur te bsod nams kyi stobs des so //
translated: and even surpass that.

original: chags pa med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum char la yang thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum char la yang thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, it would come from upholding, reciting, explaining, and being inspired by the profound and extensive Dharma associated with the Great Vehicle, and from upholding the two verses and dedicating them to perfect complete enlightenment.

original: ye shes stobs zhes bya ba ni shes bya mtha' dag rig pa'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽shes rab stobs zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes stobs zhes bya ba ni shes bya mtha' dag rig pa'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro // shes rab stobs zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: The power of wisdom is the wisdom that knows all objects of knowledge.

original: thabs kyi stobs zhes bya ba'i thabs ni grub pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi stobs zhes bya ba'i thabs ni grub pa'o //
translated: The power of method is the method of accomplishment.

original: de'i stobs ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i stobs ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Its power is that it is not fruitless.

original: ting 'dzin stobs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting 'dzin stobs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The power of samadhi is the power of samadhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mnyam par 'jog pa ste bsam gtan no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mnyam par 'jog pa ste bsam gtan no //
translated: Samadhi is meditative concentration, which is meditative development.

original: de'i stobs ni 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don bya ba dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mngon par sgrub pa la thogs pa med pa nyid de ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs des so //

translated: Its power is that it is unobstructed in the performance of benefit for all beings and in the realization of the qualities of the superknowledges and so on.🔽The power of enlightenment is the power of enlightenment.

analyzed: byang chub stobs zhes bya ba la byang chub ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
translated: Enlightenment is unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: de'i ched kyi stobs te mthu gang yin pa de yang dag par sgrub par byed ces bya ba ni de'i tshogs rnam par sgrub par byed cing ngo //
translated: The power that is for the sake of that, whatever it is, is the power of enlightenment.

original: rnam pa bcu gsum pa ni gnyen po'i yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gsum pa ni gnyen po'i yin no //
translated: The thirteenth is the power of the antidote.

original: de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi stobs 'joms par byed pa rnam pa gsum ste @246a * //
analyzed: de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi stobs 'joms par byed pa rnam pa gsum ste @246a * //

original: las kyi stobs rnams rnam par dag byed cing //
analyzed: las kyi stobs rnams rnam par dag byed cing //
translated: It purifies the power of karma

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /

analyzed: las 'di ni bye brag tu ma byas pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Karma is threefold, distinguished as virtuous, nonvirtuous, and invariable, because it is not specified here.

analyzed: de la las mi dge ba'i stobs ni nges par myong bar 'gyur ba yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu ngan 'gro gsum 'byin par nus pa yin no //

analyzed: de la smod pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis yongs su dag par byed cing sel bar byed pa ni /

original: rab tu bshags dang sdom par byed pa yis //

original: de dag shin tu rtsa nas bton par bshad //
analyzed: de dag shin tu rtsa nas bton par bshad //

original: ces gsungs pa lta bu yin no //🔽gnyen po'i stobs kyis yongs su dag par byed pa ni /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa lta bu yin no // gnyen po'i stobs kyis yongs su dag par byed pa ni /
translated: This is like the case of Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra.

original: dper na byams ma'i bu gang pos ma la brnyas pas kun nas bslang ba'i las me dag ba zhing gi khyad par gyis /
analyzed: dper na byams ma'i bu gang pos ma la brnyas pas kun nas bslang ba'i las me dag ba zhing gi khyad par gyis /
translated: The purification by the power of the antidote is like the case of Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, who through the power of the special field of the Buddha,

analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kho na la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'byin par zhugs pa 'bras bu cung zad cig kyang smin pa las /
translated: the karma of five actions of immediate retribution that he had committed out of contempt for his mother was not even slightly ripened in his present life.

original: de'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khyad par las byung ba'i sems can gyi don du smon pa'i sems bskyed pa kho nas ma lus par shin tu rtsa nas bton te bcom pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khyad par las byung ba'i sems can gyi don du smon pa'i sems bskyed pa kho nas ma lus par shin tu rtsa nas bton te bcom pa lta bu yin no //
translated: But through the power of his special superior intention, he completely uprooted and destroyed that karma by the power of generating the aspiration to attain enlightenment for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don du smon pa'i sems bskyed pa yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: sems can gyi don du smon pa'i sems bskyed pa yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is the generation of the aspiration to attain enlightenment for the sake of sentient beings?

translated: For the sake of all sentient beings who, like me, will commit the karma of disrespecting their mothers, for their sake, for as long as cyclic existence endures,🔽may I alone experience the great mass of suffering, the infinite suffering that arises from the wheel on my head, without interruption.

original: bdag kho nar mgo la 'khor los 'dab las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po mtha' yas pa snyoms par mtshams med pa nyams su myong bar gyur cig / nam du yang sems can 'ga' yang 'dir 'ong bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba yin no
analyzed: bdag kho nar mgo la 'khor los 'dab las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po mtha' yas pa snyoms par mtshams med pa nyams su myong bar gyur cig / nam du yang sems can 'ga' yang 'dir 'ong bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba yin no
translated: May no sentient being ever come here.

analyzed: // rten gyi stobs kyis yongs su dag bar byed pa ni dper na phag mo'i rtogs pa brjod pa las /

translated: The son of a god who was subject to death and transmigration was born in the womb of a sow and was about to experience the ripening of the result of karma.

analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha las shi 'phos te dga' ldan pa dag gi nang du skyes so zhes 'byung ba lta bu yin no //
translated: By merely going for refuge to the Three Jewels, he was completely and totally freed from all that and died as a god of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three and was reborn among the Tushita gods.

original: chos thams cad @246b bdag med par rtogs pas kyang shin tu rtsad nas phyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos thams cad @246b bdag med par rtogs pas kyang shin tu rtsad nas phyin par 'gyur te /
translated: By realizing that all phenomena are devoid of self, one will be completely and totally freed.

original: ji skad du las kyi sgrib pa rgyun gcod pa'i mdo las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji skad du las kyi sgrib pa rgyun gcod pa'i mdo las 'di lta ste /
translated: As the Sutra Cutting the Web of Concepts says:

analyzed: dge slong zhig mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / mi gsod pa'i phas pham pa gnyis byung ba dang / phyis mi dga' zhing yid gdungs nas myos pa bzhin du gtsug lag khang nas gtsug lag khang dang / grong nas grong dang / lam po che la sogs par 'gro na yang /
translated: A monk who has committed two defeating offenses—sexual intercourse and murder—is unhappy and tormented in mind, like one who is insane. He wanders from temple to temple, from town to town, and from highway to highway.

analyzed: sdig pa de skye bo kun gyis mngon sum du yang dag par rab tu 'chags te /

analyzed: yang dang yang du kye ma kye chud bdag ni ma rung ngo //
translated: Again and again he says, “Alas! Alas! I am ruined!

analyzed: bdag ni nyams so zhes smra zhing las de srab mor gyur gyi bar du sdig pa 'chags pa'i stobs kyis sel bar byed do //
translated: I am lost!” He expels that evil by the power of confessing it, until it is as thin as a hair.

original: de ltar sems shin tu gdungs par gyur pa de la byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa thob pa zhig gis chos zab mo de dang de lta bu bshad pa dang / de na de chos thams cad la bdag med par rtogs pas sdig pa thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtsad nas bton te mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sems shin tu gdungs par gyur pa de la byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa thob pa zhig gis chos zab mo de dang de lta bu bshad pa dang / de na de chos thams cad la bdag med par rtogs pas sdig pa thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtsad nas bton te mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who had attained the superknowledges taught him the profound Dharma, and he realized that all phenomena are selfless. He completely uprooted all his sins and attained the tolerance of the noncreation of things.

original: chos zab mo la mos pa 'di ni ltung ba dang / 'gyod pa thams cad sel ba dang / sgrib pa thams cad sbyong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar dad par bya ste /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: chos zab mo la mos pa 'di ni ltung ba dang / 'gyod pa thams cad sel ba dang / sgrib pa thams cad sbyong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar dad par bya ste / ji skad du /
translated: One should have faith that this interest in the profound Dharma removes all downfalls and regrets and purifies all obscurations.

original: 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod las /🔽'od srungs gang gi pha yin la rang sangs rgyas kyang yin pa de bsad na 'di ni srog gcod pa rnams kyi nang na mi bzad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod las / 'od srungs gang gi pha yin la rang sangs rgyas kyang yin pa de bsad na 'di ni srog gcod pa rnams kyi nang na mi bzad pa yin no //
translated: As it says in the Sublime Cloud of Jewels Sūtra:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, if someone were to kill his father, who was also a Solitary Sage, this would be the most heinous of all sins of killing.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor 'phrog pa 'di ni ma byin par len pa rnams kyi nang na mi bzad pa yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor 'phrog pa 'di ni ma byin par len pa rnams kyi nang na mi bzad pa yin no // 'di lta ste /

analyzed: ma yang yin la dgra bcom ma yang yin pa de la nyal po byas na 'di ni 'dod pas log par g-yem pa rnams kyi nang nam rungs pa yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: To have sexual relations with a woman who is both your mother and an arhat is the most terrible of all forms of sexual misconduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur ba 'debs pa 'di ni brdzun smra ba rnams kyi nang nam rungs pa yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur ba 'debs pa 'di ni brdzun smra ba rnams kyi nang nam rungs pa yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: To slander the Tathagata is the most terrible of all forms of lying.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa 'di ni phra ma rnams kyi nang na rungs pa yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa 'di ni phra ma rnams kyi nang na rungs pa yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: To cause a schism in the Sangha is the most terrible of all forms of divisive speech.

original: 'phags pa rnams la kha zer ba 'di ni tshig rtsub po rnams kyi nang na ma rungs ba yin no //🔽'di lta ste /🔽chos 'dod pa rnams rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa 'di ni tshig 'khyal ba rnams kyi nang na mi bzad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la kha zer ba 'di ni tshig rtsub po rnams kyi nang na ma rungs ba yin no // 'di lta ste / chos 'dod pa rnams rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa 'di ni tshig 'khyal ba rnams kyi nang na mi bzad pa yin no //
translated: To speak offensively to noble beings is the most terrible of all forms of offensive speech.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: To distract those who are intent on the Dharma is the most terrible of all forms of idle chatter.

original: yang dag par song ba dang yang dag par @247a * //
